placesVisited: Cape Town, Stellenbosch, Oudtshoorn, Guided tour of Cango Caves, Tsitsikamma National Park, Plettenberg Bay, Addo Elephant National Park, Port Elizabeth, Optional activities include: wine tasting, visit to an ostrich farm, bungee jumping, canopy tours, zip-ling, blackwater tubing and numerous nature walks
generalInfo:
There are just some scenic stretches, around the world, that really need to be seen, first-hand, to truly be believed. South Africa's Garden Route is one such 'must do' road trip destination, and this week-long tour provides every opportunity to find out why.

Starting out in Cape Town you'll instantly be transported to some of South Africa's best-loved sites with the wine regions around Stellenbosch one of this tour's historic and naturally appealing highlights. An ostrich farm awaits in Oudtshoorn before you drive through the Outeniqua Mountains after a guided tour of the captivating Cango caves. Plettenberg Bay provides accommodation for the night – no camping on this tour – with plenty of optional activities to allow you to stretch your legs by the seaside.

Tsitsikamma National Park tickles the toes next with a wonderful waterfall trail complementing more optional activities including everything from canopy tours and nature walks to black water tubing, bungee jumping and zip-ling.

If it's elephants that you're after on the Garden Route then the penultimate day of this seven day tour will turn those big eared dreams into reality as you enter Addo Elephant National Park.

Wildlife watching from our elevated travelling truck provides a superior vantage point for game drives, with one final game walk on Day 7 offering a chance to bid farewell to the animals prior to transferring to our final destination, Port Elizabeth, where our tour comes to a close.

Throughout this tour you'll be travelling as part of a small group and invited to take part in several optional activities along the Garden Route. Being able to pick and choose what you want to take part in is perfect for accommodating all budgets and giving travellers the chance to take things at their own pace. The itinerary below has been designed with a range of optional activities included. We recommend booking these activities in advance so as to ensure availability and to help our guides plan the tour structure accordingly. Please get in touch if you need any further details or prices.

dayInfo.description: Arrive in Cape Town Your tour starts with your arrival at Cape Town International Airport, from where you are transferred to your accommodation. This will be in the form of either a comfortable, high-quality backpacker lodge, or a more luxurious deluxe guesthouse or boutique hotel, depending on your choice. You will be free to spend the rest of the day, as well as the next day, exploring Cape Town on your own. Included activities

Free DAY in Cape Town This is your chance to experience the sights and sounds of Cape Town with 2 free days in the famous Mother City. Home to many important historical landmarks, as well some gorgeous natural sites, Cape Town has so much to offer. Table Mountain, Signal Hill, Robben Island, Hout Bay, Camps Bay, Clifton Beach, the V&A Waterfront, Constantia. You can fill your days or take them easy, as you prefer. We recommend taking a tour on the city sightseeing bus; alternatively, you can pre-book out a Cape Peninsula Tour or Cape Winelands Tour (joining with other travellers not on our trip). | OVERNIGHT
Free DAY in Cape Town You have another free day to explore Cape town today. | OVERNIGHT

Cape Coast- Hermanus, Betties Bay, Cape Agulhas, Shark Cage Diving The group joins together today as we follow the scenic Cape coastline. We depart Cape Town early, heading towards Hermanus. Guests who have chosen to do the shark cage diving activity depart separately and join up with the rest of the group later in the day. En-route to Hermanus, we make a stop at Betties Bay, where a marvelous sight awaits us
Route 62, Winery Stop, Ostrich Farm Today we travel along a famous route in South Africa

Wilderness National Park and Knysna We have an adventurous and exciting day ahead of us today. We begin by crossing the magnificent Outeniqua Mountain Pass into Wilderness National Park. We explore this beautiful landscape in a unique way- by paddling down the Touw River in canoes. This is a truly enchanting way to experience the beauty of the park, and our journey takes us through the forest, which is abundant with life. After our boating excursion, we enjoy a short 2km hike to a lovely waterfall and rock pool area. We then depart for Sedgefield, where the pristine beaches are perfect for rounding off the adventures of the day. Included activities

Knysna, Tsitsikamma National Park and Bloukrans Bridge Bungee Jump This morning, we will head to the famous town of Knysna via the beautiful Lake District of the Garden Route. Whilst in Knysna we'll visit the viewpoint, where we'll be rewarded with magnificent views of the Knysna River estuary and towards the Indian Ocean. Our next destination is Tsitsikamma National Park. En-route, we stop at the world-famous Bloukrans Bridge, the site of the highest bungee jump in the world. While the thrill-seekers in the group enjoy this must-do experience, the rest of us continue onwards to the park. Tsitsikamma National Park’s delightful combination of forest and unspoiled coastline provides a variety of activities for all. Go hiking and swimming, and cross an awesome suspension bridge across a river mouth. In the afternoon, we depart and head towards Addo. Included activities

Safari in Addo Elephant National Park, Transfer to Port Elizabeth Today is the last day of the tour, and what better way to spend it than on safari? We spend the morning exploring the vast wilderness of Addo Elephant National Park, home to an incredible diversity of wildlife species. The park is true to its name, and houses approximately 600 elephants. Also look out for zebra, kudu, eland, warthog, and, of course, the other members of the famous Big 5. After a 2-3 hour safari, we depart Addo and reach Port Elizabeth in the early afternoon. Those catching international flights will have ample time, as many depart in the early evening. Guests who wish to extend their stay may certainly do so. There is a number of options available- you can book extra nights in PE, at a lodge outside Addo, or even at a private game reserve. Please contact us for more information. Safari extension
